item.title: Deploying a static website in Azure Static Web Apps
item.description: Nowadays JAMStack is trendy because a lot of reasons: performance, security, decoupling, etc. JAMStack consists of pre-rendering your website or application’s frontend and get the dynamic data from an API. Your pre-rendered markup can be host in a server, but as it is static, your host only needs to serve static files, just HTML, CSS, and JS. You don’t need to run any code on the server.
